sentences.english: I stand in front of the calendar disappointed for a long time and a sense of desolation over my heart.
sentences.chinese: 我站在挂历前怅然了很久，一种苍凉的感觉漫过心头。

sentences.english: Her mother sparked to the idea of an early wedding date.
sentences.chinese: 她母亲怅然赞同早日举行婚礼的计划。

sentences.english: A child stood looking with wistful eyes at the toys in the window.
sentences.chinese: 一个孩子以怅然若失的目光望著橱窗中的玩具。

sentences.english: Kitty disappointed returns the United States, encountered him again in terminal London however.
sentences.chinese: 凯蒂怅然返美，却在中转站伦敦又遇见了他。

sentences.english: He accepted the job with a good grace.
sentences.chinese: 他怅然的接受了这项工作。

sentences.english: Langdon could not help but feel a deep sense of loss at the curator's death.
sentences.chinese: 对于馆长的死，兰登禁不住有一种怅然若失的感受。

sentences.english: The dealer harvest season, while I was harvesting a heart filled with thoughts and sense of loss.
sentences.chinese: 一季的庄家收获了，而我却收获着满心的思念和怅然。

sentences.english: The micro-Tri-gloss has all functions of the new generation readily at hand.
sentences.chinese: 微观三光泽已怅然手头新一代的全部功用。

sentences.english: Finally can be inside or pain in your tears, smile or sense of loss.
sentences.chinese: 终于也可以在眼泪里或者疼痛或者怅然地微笑。

sentences.english: The reader already readily spread the thread on the readymade bread.
sentences.chinese: 那位读者已经怅然将丝线铺散在现成的面包上。

sentences.english: Sitting in the office, I feel somehow upset.
sentences.chinese: 坐在办公室，心里有些怅然。

sentences.english: He dared not to enter and waited till midnight, but the chess playing continued, so he returned home disappointed.
sentences.chinese: 大用不敢入内，候至深夜，棋声不停，只得怅然而返。

sentences.english: I've only met him several times, but right now I feel this big empty hole in my heart.
sentences.chinese: 我只见过他几面，却觉得心中怅然若失悲伤不已。

sentences.english: Then he noticed a single white feather had fallen from it.
sentences.chinese: 发现这一点后，他不免有些怅然若失。

definition: as if one had lost something (idiom)/to look or feel unsettled or distracted/to feel empty
to lose (sth)/to drop (sth)/to feel a sense of loss/frustrated/disappointment/loss
